page.title: 08Health Service Cookley Green
page.content: There are two small community hospitals at Henley and Watlington where patients are admitted and treated by their own doctor. There are no facilities for X- ray or surgery. Most of the patients suffer from chronic illnesses associated with old age. Some acute medical cases are admitted and people needing convalescent care transferred from larger hospitals to be nearer home. Elderly patients and chronically sick of any age are admitted for check- ups to maintain health standards and to provide relief for relatives. Day centres provide meals and hairdressing services for needy housebound patients; they are driven to and from hospital by ambulance. A hospital car service run by volunteers can also provide transport to hospital or doctors surgery if needed.
